ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā lotus pond.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.2_0: At that time in the country of Kāsī there was a village called Vāsabha.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.3_0: The resident monk there, Kassapagotta, was dedicated to the local monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.4_0: trying to get good monks to come, to make those who had come be at ease, and to make the local monastery grow and reach maturity.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.5_0: At this time a number of monks who were wandering in Kāsī arrived at Vāsabha.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.6_0: When Kassapagotta saw those monks coming, he prepared seats, and he set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, and water for washing the feet. He then went out to meet them, received their bowls and robes, and asked if they wanted water to drink. He helped them get a bath and also with rice porridge, non-staple foods, and meals.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.8_0: “He’s great, this resident monk, in that he helps us with all these things.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.9_0: Let’s settle down right here in Vāsabha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.1.10_0: Then those newly arrived monks sat down on the village of Abhaya.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.2.3_0: And by now they know where to get alms.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.2.4_0: It’s hard for people to live with others who are skilled and tirelessly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.2.5_0: Let me stop helping them with rice porridge, non-staple foods, and meals.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.2.8_0: “Previously, this resident monk must have eaten rice porridge and non-staple foods, and meals.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.2.9_0: But he has stopped helping us with food.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.3.1_0: Those newly arrived monks said to Kassapagotta,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.3.2_0: “Firstly, Reverend, you have stopped helping us with food.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.3.3_0: But you have stopped helping us with food.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.3.6_0: “I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.3.7_0: Those newly arrived monks then ejected Kassapagotta for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.3.9_0: ‘I don’t know that one has committed this offense or that they haven’t been ejected for not making amends for it. And they deserve a legitimate legal procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.3.10_0: Let me go to Campā and ask the Buddha about this.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.4.1_0: He then put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and set out for Campā.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.4.2_0: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.5.27_0: Then those visiting mendicants ejected me for not recognizing an offense.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.5.30_0: Let me go to Campā and ask the Buddha about this.’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.5.31_0: and finished by saying, “That’s where I’ve come from.”

ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.6.6_0: “Yes, sir,” replied Kassapagotta. He got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.7.1_0: Soon those newly arrived monks became anxious and remorseful:
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.7.3_0: that we have ejected, without reason, a pure monk who hadn’t committed any offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.7.4_0: Well then, let’s go to Campā and confess our offense in the presence of the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.7.5_0: Then those newly arrived monks put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and left for Campā.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.8.1_0: “Are you the ones who ejected the resident monk?”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.8.6_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.8.7_0: How can you, without reason, eject a pure monk who had not committed any offense?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.8.8_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.8.9_0: after criticizing them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.8.10_0: “You should not, without reason, eject a pure monk who hasn’t committed any offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.8.11_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.9.1_0: Those monks then got up from their seats, put their upper robe over one shoulder, bowed down with their heads at the Buddha’s feet, and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.9.2_0: “We have made a mistake, sir. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of us to eject a monk who hadn’t committed any offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.9.3_0: Please accept our confession for our future restraint.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.9.4_0: “Certainly you have committed an offense. Foolishly, deludedly, and unskillfully you acted like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.9.5_0: But since you have recognized your mistake for what it is, and have dealt with it properly, I accept it.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:1.9.6_0: For this is called growth in the training of the noble ones: acknowledging an offense, making amends in accordance with the Teaching, and undertaking restraint for the future.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.1.1_0: At that time the monks at Campā did legal procedures such as these:

ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.1.3_0: legitimate legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly, legitimate-like legal procedures done by an incomplete assembly,

ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.3.17_0: Three ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.3.18_0: A sangha ejecting a sangha is invalid and not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.4.1_0: There are these four kinds of legal procedure:
ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.4.2_0: an illegitimate legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly, an illegitimate legal procedure done unanimously, a legitimate legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly, and a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.4.3_0: The illegitimate legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly is reversible and unfit to stand, because it is illegitimate and the assembly is incomplete.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.4.8_0: You should not do such procedures; I have allowed such procedures.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:2.4.11_0: Therefore, monks, you should train yourselves like this: ‘We will do legal procedures that are legitimate and unanimous.’”

ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.3.1_0: “Monks, there are these six kinds of legal procedure:

ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.3.4_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they do a procedure with one motion but no announcement, it is an illegitimate legal procedure.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.5.1_0: And what is the legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.5.2_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if the monks who should be present haven’t all arrived or the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.5.3_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if the monks who should be present have arrived but the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.5.4_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent but someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.5.5_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if the monks who should be present haven’t all arrived or the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.5.6_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if the monks who should be present have arrived but the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.5.7_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent but someone present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.6.2_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done unanimously.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.6.3_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legal procedure done unanimously.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.6.4_0: This is called a legal procedure done unanimously.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.7.2_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they make the announcement first and put forward the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present haven’t all arrived or the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.7.4_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they make the announcement first and put forward the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent but someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.7.5_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they make the announcements first and put forward the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present haven’t all arrived or the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.7.6_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they make the announcements first and put forward the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived but the consent hasn’t been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent or someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.7.7_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they make the announcements first and put forward the motion afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent but someone present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.7.8_0: This is called a legitimate-like legal procedure done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.8.1_0: “And what is a legitimate-like legal procedure done unanimously?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.8.2_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they make the announcement first and put forward the motion afterwards, and the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done unanimously.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.8.3_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they make the announcements first and put forward the motion afterwards, and the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate-like legal procedure done unanimously.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.8.4_0: This is called a legitimate-like legal procedure done unanimously.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.9.1_0: “And what is a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.9.2_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and one announcement, if they put forward the motion first and make the announcement afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.9.3_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and three announcements, if they put forward the motion first and make the announcements afterwards, and if the monks who should be present have arrived and the consent has been brought for those who are eligible to give their consent and no-one present objects to the decision, it is a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:3.9.4_0: This is called a legitimate legal procedure done unanimously.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.1.3_0: A sangha of monks consisting of a group of four—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures except three:
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.1.5_0: A sangha of monks consisting of a group of five—unanimous, acting legitimately—is able to do all legal procedures except two.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.1.6_0: In the middle countries, there is legitimate and unanimous.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.1_0: “In the midst of the Sangha, the objections of some are valid, not the objections of others.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.2_0: Whose objections are invalid in the midst of the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.3_0: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of a nun is invalid.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.4_0: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of a trainee nun,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.7_0: of one who has renounced the training,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.8_0: one who has committed the worst kind of offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.12_0: of one who has been ejected for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.13_0: of one who has been ejected for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.14_0: of one who has been ejected for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.16_0: of one living in the community by theft,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.17_0: of one who has previously left to join the ascetics of another religion,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.21_0: of a murderer of a perfected one,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.22_0: of one who has raped a nun,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.23_0: of one who has caused a schism in the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.24_0: of one who has caused the Buddha to bleed,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.26_0: of one belonging to a different Buddhist sect,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.27_0: of one who is within a different monastic boundary,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.28_0: of one floating in the air by supernormal power,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.7.29_0: or of one who is subject to the legal procedure is invalid.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.8.1_0: Whose objections are valid in the midst of the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.8.2_0: In the midst of the Sangha, the objection of a regular monk, who belongs to the same Buddhist sect and is staying within the same monastic boundary, even if only declared to a monk sitting next to him, is valid.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.8.3_0: This is the object of the midst of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.1_0: “There are two kinds of sending away.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.2_0: If the Sangha sends away those who don’t have the attributes needed for being sent away,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.3_0: the sending away of some succeeds, while the sending away of others fails.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.4_0: Who are those whose sending away fails?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.5_0: Those who are pure, without offenses.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.6_0: This is called a person who doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, and who admits to them, his admittance fails.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.7_0: Who are those whose sending away fails?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.8_0: Those who are ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have committed an offense, constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.9.9_0: This is called a person who hasn’t failed for those who don’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, but if the Sangha admits them, his admittance fails.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.1_0: “There are these two kinds of sending away.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.2_0: If the Sangha admits those who don’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, the admittance of some succeeds, while the admittance of others fails.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.3_0: Who are those whose admittance fails?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.4_0: The Sangha admits those who don’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, but if the Sangha admits him, his admittance fails.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.5_0: If the Sangha admits to living in the community by theft, the admittance of one living in the community by theft, and if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.6_0: One who has previously left to join the ascetics of another religion,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.10_0: a murderer of a perfected one,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.11_0: one who has raped a nun,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.12_0: one who has caused a schism in the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.13_0: one who has caused the Buddha to bleed,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.14_0: a hermaphrodite doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, and if the Sangha admits him, his admittance fails.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.10.15_0: they’re called a person who hasn’t attained admitted, but if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.1_0: Who are those whose admittance succeeds?
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.2_0: One without a hand doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, but if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.4_0: one without a hand and a foot,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.8_0: one without a finger or a toe,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.30_0: one who is blind and mute,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.31_0: one who is blind and deaf,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.32_0: one who is mute and deaf,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.33_0: one who is blind and mute and deaf doesn’t have the attributes needed for being admitted, but if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.34_0: they’re called a person who hasn’t yet admitted, and if the Sangha admits him, his admittance succeeds.”
ai-pli-tv-kd9:4.11.36_0: The first section for recitation on the village of Vāsabha is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.1_0: “It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to recognize,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.2_0: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.3_0: ‘You have committed an offense. Do you recognize it?’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.5_0: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should recognize,’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.6_0: yet the Sangha ejects him for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.7_0: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.8_0: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to make amends for,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.9_0: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.10_0: ‘You have committed an offense. Do you make amends for it?’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.12_0: ‘I haven’t committed any offense that I should make amends for,’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.13_0: yet the Sangha ejects him for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.14_0: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.15_0: It may be that a monk doesn’t have any bad view he needs to give up,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.16_0: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.17_0: ‘You have a bad view that you need to give up.’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.19_0: ‘I don’t have any bad view that I should give up,’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.20_0: and the Sangha ejects him for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.1.21_0: then the legal procedure is illegitimate.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.2.1_0: “It may be that a monk doesn’t have any offense he needs to recognize, nor one that he needs to make amends for,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.2.2_0: and the Sangha, several monks, or an individual monk accuses him, saying:
ai-pli-tv-kd9:5.2.3_0: ‘You have committed an offense; do you recognize it?

ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.1.1_0: “It may be, monks, that a monk is quarrelsome and argumentative, one who creates legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.1.2_0: If they consider this and think,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.1.3_0: ‘This monk is quarrelsome and argumentative, one who creates legal issues in the Sangha.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.1.5_0: They do a procedure of condemnation against him—

ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.6.1_0: “It may be, monks, that a monk is ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense, constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.6.3_0: ‘This monk is ignorant, incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense, constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.6.4_0: Well then, let’s do a procedure of demotion against him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.6.5_0: They do a procedure of demotion against him—

ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.0_0: Discussion of the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.1_0: “It may be that a monk commits an offense but doesn’t wish to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.2_0: If they consider this and think,
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.3_0: ‘This monk has committed an offense but doesn’t wish to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.4_0: Well then, let’s do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.5_0: They do a procedure of ejection against him—
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.6_0: illegitimately and with an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.7_0: He then goes to another monastery.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.9_0: ‘The Sangha did a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against this monk—illegitimately and with an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.10_0: Well then, let’s do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.11_0: They do a procedure of ejection against him—
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.13_0: legitimately but with an incomplete assembly. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd9:7.9.14_0: in a legitimate-like way and with an incomplete assembly. ...
